name: Chicken Curry, Lombok Style
author: Madhur Jaffrey
source: A Taste of the Far East, pg.299
ingredients:
**For the paste:
- 1 red pepper, chopped
- 3 hot red chillies, chopped
- 2.5cm piece of ginger, chopped
- 6 raw cashew nuts
- 1 large onion, chopped
- 5 cloves garlic, peeled
- 1/2 tsp shrimp paste
- 1/2 tsp cumin seeds
- 1 tsp whole black peppercorns
- 4 good size slices of galangal
- 4 whole cloves
- 2.5cm cinnamon stick

**Curry:
- 400g can of coconut milk
- 8 tbsp vegetable oil
- 1.5kg chicken thighs
- 11/2 tsp salt
instructions:
- Put the red pepper, chillies, cashews, onion, garlic and shrimp paste into a blender, and blend until it is a smooth paste, adding a little water if required.
- Put the cumin, peppercorns, galangal, cloves and cinnamon into a grinder and grid until fine. Put this powder into the blender and whiz to mix.

- Open the can of coconut without shaking it. Spoon off the cream from on top, and set it aside. Pour the remaining milk into a measureing jug and top up to 350ml with water.
- Heat the oil in a wok, and when hot, put in the curry paste from the blender. Stir and fry for 6-8 minutes, until the paste is dark red and reduced.
- Add the chicken pieces and salt, stir and fry for another 2 minutes.
- Now put un the thinned coconut milk and bring to a boil. Cover, lower the heat and gently simmer for 30 minutes.
- Uncover and cook on medium heat for 5 minutes, then turn the heat off.
- Spoon off most of the oil that has risen to the top. Stir in the coconut cream and mix well.
